intro: Ferulago macrosciadea, commonly known as the large-leafed ferulago, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory properties. Ferulago macrosciadea thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sunny, well-drained habitats.
